data.title: 2024 Fellows & Studio Artists
data.meta_description: Meet the 2024 Fellows & Studio Artists Learn more about each of our brilliant fellows and Lehrer Vocal Institute studio artists below! Click a category below to expand and view each group. VIOLIN VIOLA CELLO DOUBLE BASS FLUTE OBOE CLARINET BASSOON HORN TRUMPET TROMBONE & TUBA PERCUSSION HARP SOLO PIANO COLLABORATIVE PIANO LEHRER VOCAL INSTITUTE […]
data.text:
ABOUT

Anthony is currently earning his master’s degree from the Juilliard School, where he studies with Daniel Phillips and Kenneth Renshaw and is a recipient of the of the Morse Teaching Fellowship. He is the winner of the Barbara Robinson Prize in the 2016 New South Wales Secondary Schools Concerto Competition, and the 3rd place winner in the 2014 Wenkart Foundation Violin Competition. He has performed with the Korngold Violin Concerto and the Ku-ring-gai Philharmonic Orchestra. Anthony is a founding member of the Prometheus Quartet, with whom he has performed in Juilliard’s ChamberFest.

ABOUT

Miles is earning a master’s degree at the Cleveland Institute of Music as a student of Jaime Laredo and Malcolm Lowe. He is the current Assistant Concertmaster of the Cleveland Institute of Music Orchestra and former member of the Monterey Symphony and Modesto Symphony. In 2023, he placed third in the Lewisville Lake International Competition for Strings and Harp and Participated in the New York String Institute Seminar. Miles also performed as principal second violin with the 2022 Roundtop Festival Institute.

ABOUT

Clara is currently earning her bachelor’s degree at The Cleveland Institute of Music, studying with Jaime Laredo and Malcolm Lowe. She was a competitor at the 2022 Louis Spohr International Violin Competition, and a laureate of the 2021 Chicago International Violin Competition. She has performed under the baton of Leonard Slatkin, JoAnn Falletta, and Anthony Parnther during the 2022-2023 season with the CIM Orchestra. She is a member of the Trio Ecclesia, a piano trio.

ABOUT

Julie is currently earning her bachelor’s degree at the Juilliard School, where she studies with Daniel Phillips and is a Pre-College Orchestra Mentor. She is the winner of the Lakewood Symphony Orchestra Young Artists Competition, and the Broomfield Symphony Orchestra Young Artists Competition. She performed as the first chair in the New York String Orchestra Seminar under conducter Jaime Laredo, and is associate concertmaster in the Julliard Chamber Orchestra. Julie is a member of the European American Musical Alliance.

ABOUT

Kenneth is earning his master’s degree from the Peabody Institute of John Hopkins University in the studio of Victoria Chang. A 2023 Music Academy alum, he was the principal violist of the Canton Symphony for their 2022 season. He also performed as substitute violist with the World Symphony and Madison Symphony. In 2022, he was a finalist in the Cleveland Institute of Music Concerto Competition. While in residence at Arcadia University, he was a member of HEXTET. Kenneth is a SphinxConnect fellow.

ABOUT

Clara recently completed her master’s degree at McGill University, studying with André Roy. She has performed with the Pronto Musica Chamber Orchestra and the Knoxville Symphony Orchestra as a section soloist. She has formerly worked as a classical programmer and announcer for public radio and has served on the Board of Directors for the Big Ears Festival and Organization. Clara is honored to play on a 2016 Grubaugh and Seifert viola, on generous loan by the Virtu Foundation.

ABOUT

Nicolas recently earned his master’s degree from University of Southern California Thornton School of Music in the studio of Yura Lee. A 2023 alum of the Music Academy, he has since performed as inaugural violist with the Thornton Virtuosi Quintet and substituted in the New World Symphony. In 2023, he was a finalist in the Thornton Concerto Competition, received a fellowship from the Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra, and was invited to teach a masterclass at the National University of Columbia. An avid Baroque musician, he has performed with the Fantasmi Baroque Ensemble and the Musica Angelica Baroque Orchestra.

ABOUT

Stacey is earning her bachelor’s degree from The Juilliard School in the studio of Astrid Schween. There, she is a member of The Juilliard Orchestra. Stacey has also been featured with the Seocho Philharmonic in Carnegie Hall as well as the Seoul Academy Ensemble and Seoul National Orchestra. In 2020, she performed a student solo recital at Colburn Academy She has also won prizes at the Osaka International Music Competition, 2020 YoungArts National Arts Competition, and 2018 Korea Chunchoo Magazine Competition.

ABOUT

Shijie is currently earning his master’s degree at the New England Conservatory, studying with Blaise Dejardin. In 2021 he won third prize in the Primuz International Strings Competition, and he was the first prize winner in the 2017 Vienna International Music Competition for chamber music. He has performed as the principal cellist with the New England Conservatory’s New Music Ensemble, and as a guest chamber performer with the Jiangsu Grand Theatre.

ABOUT

Belle recently completed her advanced diploma from the Eastman School of Music and received the Celentano award, studying with Steven Doane and Rosemary Elliott. She will now begin her doctorate studies at the Indiana University Jacobs School of Music studying with Eric Kim as a recipient of the Performance Fellowship. In 2018 she was the winner of the Young Professional Division of the Tennessee Cello Workshop Competition, and was a finalist in the 2023 Music Teacher’s National Association Chamber competition. She has performed as a soloist with the Texas Christian University Orchestra and the Allen Philharmonic Orchestra.

ABOUT

Jamie is a returning 2022 Music Academy fellow. She recently earned her master’s degree from The Juilliard School as a student of Carol Wincenc and Jim Walker. In 2023, she was a semifinalist in the Susan Wadsworth International competition and the National Flute Association Young Artist Competition. That same year, she placed second in the New York Flute Club Competition. Jamie has performed in the New World Symphony and as principal flute in The Juilliard Orchestra.

ABOUT

Izaiah is earning his bachelor’s degree at Curtis Institute of Music in the studios of Katherine Needleman and Philippe Tondre. In October 2023, he performed Reena Esmail’s Pranayam on NPR’s “From the Top” with Peter Dugan. Competition victories include the 2022 Schubert Club Young Artist Competition and the 2023 Minnesota Orchestra Young People’s Symphony Concert Association Concerto Competition. The latter culminated in performances of the Martinu Oboe Concerto in January 2024. He also has performed with the National Youth Orchestra as co-principal oboist and English horn soloist.

ABOUT

Francisco is earning his master’s degree from the Real Conservatorio Superior de Música de Madrid in the studio of Javier Alcaraz Leon. After passing a public examination in 2019, he has performed in several military bands in Spain. He has been a member of the Music Unit of the Spanish Royal Guard since 2023.. He is a former member of the Young Orchestra of Extremadura brass section.

ABOUT

Jacob Hord recently earned his master’s degree at San Francisco Conservatory in the studio of Jacob Nissly. He also studied at the Southern Methodist University as a student of George Nickson and Brian Jones. Jacob regularly performs as principal timpanist with the Dallas Wind Symphony and Springfield Symphony and as organist for the Northridge Presbyterian Church. As timpanist, he has appeared with the Louisiana Philharmonic Orchestra and New Mexico Philharmonic. When not performing, he teaches at the Dallas Academy of Music and Performing Arts.

ABOUT

Sol is earning her graduate diploma at Conservatorio della Svizzera italiana as a student of Alexander Kobrin. In 2022, she was a winner in the Young Artist Piano Performance Competition and placed second in the Stecher and Horowitz Two-Piano Competition, both held by the Music Teachers National Association. She placed first in the 2018 Topeka Symphony Young Artist Competition. Sol has attended Pianofest in the Hamptons and participated in several masterclass taught by renowned artists such as Music Academy Faculty Emeritus Jerome Lowenthal. Other notable performances have been with the TIMM Ensemble, Heritage Philharmonic and Busan Neo Philharmonic Orchestra (at eleven years old!).

ABOUT

Jiwoo is currently earning her degree at The Juilliard School, studying with Jonathan Feldman. She won 1st prize in the chamber music category in the 2020 online edition of the International Music Competition, as well as Best Duo Ensemble and Audience Favorite at the 1st Vietnam International Music Competition for Violin and Chamber Music in 2019. She has performed as part of a duo at Juilliard and is a member of the piano duo “Comme Toi.”

ABOUT

Julia earned her bachelor’s degree from Loyola University as a student of Irini Kyriakidou-Hymel. She has continued to reside and work in New Orleans, Louisiana since graduating. There, she has served as cantor for the St. Francis of Assisi Church since 2020. In 2024, she won the New Orleans District Winner at the Metropolitan Opera Laffont Competition and the second-place prize at the FAVA Grand Concours French Opera and Art Song Competition. Julia has appeared with the Lousiana Philharmonic and performed as Lia in Debussy’s L’enfant prodigue, Pamina in Mozart’s Die Zauberflöte, and Countess Almaviva in Mozart’s Le nozze di Figaro.

ABOUT

Lydia earned her bachelor’s degree at University of Southern California Thornton School of Music in the studio of Rod Gilfry. She also has studied with Melena Kitíc. Lydia won the 2019 grand prize in The Music Center’s Spotlight Awards and was a finalist in the 2021 Opera Viva! Roberto de Simone Memorial Aria Competition. She has recently performed in Gilbert & Sullivan’s The Pirates of Penzance as a cover for Ruth, as the Stewardess in Jonathan Dove’s Flight, and as Dorabella in Mozart’s Cosí fan tutte. Residing in Los Angeles, she has also sung with the Pacific Opera Project and with workshops for Beth Morrison Projects.

ABOUT

Matthew earned his master’s degree at the Mannes School of Music as a student of Arthur Levy. Currently, he studies with Jonathan Beyer. He recently performed in Puccini’s Turandot as Pong and debuted his own cabaret show, An Evening with Matthew Cerillo. He has participated in several opera productions including Bizet’s Carmen, where he performed as El Remendado and covered Don Jose, Mozart’s Die Zauberflöte as Tamino, Le nozze di Figaro as Don Basilio, Purcell’s The Fairy-Queen as Demitrius, and John Gay’s The Beggar’s Opera in the roles of Dianna Trapes, Filch, and Ben Budge. Matthew has also performed in international events such as Ukranian Artists Music, Music in the Alps, and the Oyster Bay Music Festival. With the St. Petersburg Opera and Portland Opera, he acted as Resident Artist in 2024 and 2022, respectively. He has performed in and collaborated with Missy Mazzoli in workshops for her new opera, The Listeners.

ABOUT

Xuyue is earning his doctoral degree at the Eastman School of Music in the studio of Anthony Dean Griffey. He performed as the Chevalier de la Force in Dialogues des Carmélites by Francis Poulenc. There, he serves as a graduate teaching assistant. At the 2019 S. Livingston Mather Scholarship Competition, he won the Albert Rees Davis Award. He also won first prizes at the 2019 National Association of Teachers of Singing Competition (Ohio Chapter).

ABOUT

Jack is earning his bachelor’s degree in Performance from Pacific Lutheran University under the instruction of Holly Boaz, James Brown, and Barry Johnson. He won first place prizes in the 2023 Angela Meade Competition and National Association for Teachers in Singing National Student Audition (Upper Classical, TBB). With the Vashon Opera, he has performed as Paris in Gounod’s Roméo et Juliette with the Vashon Opera. Jack’s roles with the Pacific Lutheran University Opera include Sam in Bernstein’s Trouble in Tahiti, and Dr. Dulcamara in Donizetti’s L’elisir d’amore. He currently resides in Gig Harbor, Washington and serves as Choral Scholar at the Christ Episcopal Church in Tacoma, Washington.

ABOUT

Romanian born baritone Teo Munteanu began taking voice lessons at the age of 16 at the advice of his high school choir teacher. His mentors, Gail Dubinbaum & John Massaro, coached him and nurtured his love for music. After developing his technique and expanding his repertoire, he started competing in various vocal competitions and began receiving offers from conservatories in both the US and Europe.

At Indiana University’s Jacobs School of Music, Teo studied under the tutelage of Andreas Poulimenos and was cast in several productions there, making his professional debut with the Indianapolis Symphony Orchestra as a freshman in the 2016 production of Carmen. Continuing his studies in Europe, he performed in various recitals & concerts throughout Italy, Germany, Romania, Ukraine, & Russia before returning to the United States.

He performed the titular role in Mozart’s Don Giovanni with the Rossini Opera Festival Orchestra in Pesaro, Italy, and later reprised the role in Chicago under the direction of Viktoria Vizin before coming to Santa Barbara to participate in Music Academy of the West’s prestigious Lehrer Vocal Institute program.

Teo loves meeting new people whenever he performs in a new city, creating lasting friendships and partnerships. He loves attending events and exploring the local scene – starting with the coffee shops, museums, & hidden gems that his new friends recommend!

ABOUT

Michael earned his bachelor’s degree from California State University Fullerton, where he studied with Kerry Jennings, Mark Goodrich, and Aram Barsamian. With the local Opera Santa Barbara, he has performed the roles of the King in Xavier Montsalvatge’s El gato con botas and Moralés in Bizet’s Carmen. Michael played the role of Dr. Falke in Opera San Luis Obispo’s production of Johann Strauss II’s Die Fledermaus. He has also collaborated with the Pacific Chorale, San Diego Opera, Lyric Opera of Orange County, and the Pacific Symphony. Currently, Michael resides in Menifee, California.

ABOUT

Eric is earning his master’s degree in collaborative piano from the University of Michigan, where he studies with Martin Katz. He won the Rosholt Distinction in Accompanying Prize in 2021 and 2022 and was a Luther College Concerto Competition winner in 2021. Recent performances include Puccini’s La bohème and Gianni Schicchi as well as in Johann Strauss II’s Die Fledermaus. From 2017-2021, he was the Summer Theater Music Director for the Fairmount Opera House.

ABOUT

Jerome is a pianist-coach at the Opéra de Montréal and works with Les Grands Ballets and Ballet Divertimento. He has studied with Jennifer Szeto, Olivier Godin, and Esther Gonthier. As part of the Opéra de Montréal’s Atelier Lyrique residency program, he served as repétitéur on Monteverdi’s L’incoronazione di Poppea and Verdi’s La traviata. Jerome has also collaborated as pianist and coach with Orchestra Drummondvill on Donizetti’s L’elisir d’amore. Still active in Montréal, Jerome also has been a ballet pianist for Les Grands Ballets Canadiens.

ABOUT

Deven recently earned his master’s degree from Indiana University Jacobs School of Music in the studio of Kevin Murphy. There, he served as a teaching assistant in collaborative piano. He has collaborated on numerous operas such as Gounod’s Roméo et Juliette with the Tel Aviv Summer Opera Program and Cedar Rapids Opera’s production of Puccini’s Tosca. With the Indiana University Opera Theater, he collaborated in productions of Roméo et Juliette, Tchaikovsky’s Eugene Onegin, and the world premiere of Shulamit Ran’s Anne Frank. Deven currently resides in Erie, Pennsylvania.

ABOUT

Tzu Kuang is a returning 2022 Music Academy alum who is earning a doctorate at the University of Texas at Austin in the studio of Tamar Sanikidze. He was named winner of the 2022 Marilyn Horne Song Competition alongside Joanne Evans, whom he still performs with. In 2023, he participated in Carnegie Hall’s Song Studio and Cincinatti Song Institute’s Fellowship of Song. He has also served as coach for University of Texas productions of Tan Dan’s Tea: A Mirror of Souls and Poulenc’s La voix humaine.

ABOUT

Paige earned a bachelor’s degree in vocal performance and opera and a certificate in musical theatre from Northwestern University. They have remained active in Chicago, Illinois, having served as Teaching Artist with the Lyric Opera and Associate Director with the Gilbert & Sullivan Opera Company. With the Ouroboros Opera, they have directed notable operas such as Bluebeard’s Castle by Bartók and the Chicago premiere La Femme Bohème, the latter of which is a reimagining of Puccini’s La bohème with the Valkyrie Orchestra. Most recently, they associate directed Ruddigore with the Gilbert & Sullivan Opera Company and directed Okoye’s Wet Dirt with the Thompson Street Opera Company. This summer, Paige will be assistant directing the Music Academy’s productions of Bizet’s Carmen (with Ken Cazan) and Ravel’s L’enfant et les sortilèges (with Mary Birnbaum).

ABOUT

Sophia recently earned her bachelor’s degree at the New England Conservatory, where she studied with Carole Haber, JJ Penna, and Luke Housner. There, she has played notable roles such as Fiordiligi in Mozart’s Cosí fan tutte and Rosalinde in Johann Strauss II’s Die Fledermaus. She has also performed as Donna Elvira in Mozart’s Don Giovanni and reprised her role in Die Fledermaus with the Lyric Opera Weinmar. Currently, Sophia resides in Boston, Massachussetts.

ABOUT

Jamie is earning his bachelor’s degree from the Oberlin Conservatory of Music, where he studies with Salvatore Champagne. He won a gold prize at the 2022 YoungArts Competition and was a finalist in the 2023 Schmidt Vocal Competition; he returned to the latter to win an Encouragement Award in 2024. Jamie has played Supt. Budd in Britten’s Albert Herring. Jamie currently resides in Los Angeles, California.

ABOUT

Derek recently earned his master’s degree from Florida State University, where he studied with David Okerlund. There, he performed roles such as Bartolo in Mozart’s Le nozze di Figaro, Basilio in Rossini’s Il barbiere di Siviglia, and Jezevec and Farář in Janáček’s The Cunning Little Vixen. He also served as a graduate teaching assistant. In 2022, he won the first place prize in the National Association for Teachers of Singing Competition’s Upper Classical TBB division.

ABOUT

Xi is earning her doctorate from the Eastman School of Music in the studio of Andrew Harley. She was a winner of the 2017 Changjiang Piano Scholarship. In 2023, she was a piano fellow at the Toronto Summer Music Festival, where she collaborated in a reimagined performance of Puccini’s Madame Butterfly. she also holds the Brook Smith Fellowship at the Eastman School of Music.

ABOUT

Collin is earning his master’s degree from Rice University Shepherd School of Music where he studies with Nova Thomas and Thomas Jaber. He placed second in the National Association for Teachers of Singing (NATS) National Student Auditions. Notable roles include Billy Bigelow in Rodgers & Hammerstein’s Carousel and the titular role in Tchaikovsky’s Eugene Onegin. While earning his bachelor’s at the Abilene Christian University, he also performed solo roles in Faure’s Requiem and a capella choir concerts.

ABOUT

Kayla recently earned her bachelor’s degree from the Eastman School of Music, where she studied with Joshua Conyers. She has also studied with Kathleen Cowdrick and Ruth Hennessy. She was a finalist in the 2024 Schmidt Vocal Undergraduate Competition and winner of the 2023 Mary E. Singletary Vocal Arts Competition. She performed numerous roles with the Eastman Opera Theater, such as Anne in Heggie’s To Hell and Back, Oberto (cover) in Handel’s Alcina, and Paula in Catán’s Florencina en el Amazonas. Kayla also performed as a back-up singer for Jon Batiste in the American Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Hall.
